summary: This is a Bureau of Prisons (BOP) Human Resources staffing report for the Custody unit in the Northeast Region, covering pay period 16 (August 4-17, 2019). It details authorized positions, filled positions, vacancies, and recruitment efforts for correctional officers and other staff, providing a snapshot of personnel levels at the time.

persons.name: Ramon Chiniuk
persons.context: Listed as a GS-11 Lieutenant in the staffing report for a custody unit.

persons.name: Evan U Winan
persons.context: Listed as a Correctional Officer in the staffing report for a custody unit.

events.title: Staffing Report Period
events.description: The report covers pay period 16, spanning from August 4 to August 17, 2019, detailing staffing levels for BOP Custody units.

keyFacts: The document is a routine Bureau of Prisons HR staffing report, not directly related to Epstein's crimes or associates.
It shows staffing levels (authorized, filled, vacant positions) for Custody units in the BOP's Northeast Region for mid-August 2019.
The report includes recruitment statuses for various positions like Correctional Officers, Lieutenants, and clerks.
The document date (August 15, 2019) is shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody on August 10, 2019, but the report itself contains no mention of him or related events.
